comments.body:
parameter retkwargs is not used;
should avoid using function parameters which are not implemented...

If `candidate` config and `running` config is same `changed` variable won't be set. In this case `running` config won't be copied to `startup` config even if they are different. I think if `save` option is enabled need to compare between `startup` datastore and `running` datastore and perform `copy_config` only if they are different.

This limitation is acceptable. The target of the module is NOT to do a stand-alone "copy running-config to startup-config". The aim is, that changes (if any) are persistently stored. At least the code proposal is doing this job.
The issue with your proposal would be, that the NETCONF server must support <get-config> on the <startup> datastore - which is not commonly supported by all netconf servers in the market. Also it is unclear, how the module returns the "changed" attribute - if edit-config results in unchanged config - while copy running to startup was still triggered, because of any differences.

For `startup` datastore there is a check in your code to identify if server supports `startup` capability or not and `running` datastore is supported by all Netconf server's, so I am not clear on the limitation of getting diff between `startup` and `running` config.

I have been hitting an issue here, where `m` ends up being a module_utils.connection.Connection without a `get_capabilities` method. I'm using `ansible_network_os=default` to access an openyuma server. That works without using `ansible_connection=netconf`

diffHunk:

        m = Connection(module._socket_path)
        capabilities = module.from_json(m.get_capabilities())
        server_capabilities = capabilities.get('server_capabilities')

      If the value is I(stop-on-error) abort the config edit on first error, if value is I(continue-on-error)
